description:
A killer is on the run! Police are in hot pursuit, and the fugitive has taken to the woods along a rural highway. Local residents have found evidence of his path, but officers scribbled down bits of information in a rush. Match each piece of evidence to the mile marker where it was found and the witness who found it to help track the killer.
The permissible items are: 
Evidence: ['Knife', 'Cigarette Butt', 'Bloodied Shirt', 'Shoe Print', "Victim's Hair"]
Witness: ['Scout Troop', 'Couple', 'Dog Walker', 'Ranger', 'Hiker']
Mile Marker: ['83 Miles', 'Hiker', '85 Miles', '84 Miles']

clues.text: Either the forest ranger or the bloodied shirt were near mile marker 86.
The lady walking her dog (a schnauzer cross poodle, otherwise known as a schnoodle) didn't spot any shoe prints.
The victim's hair, the item found near mile marker 85, and the clues discovered by the hiker and the scout troop are four different pieces of evidence.
The mile marker where the scout troop made camp was one mile more than where the hiker found her piece of evidence.
The suspect abandoned his blood stained shirt near mile marker 82.
A cigarette butt in the suspect's favorite brand was found at the mile marker one mile less than where the strands of hair were found.
The murder weapon was found at mile marker 86. It was purchased earlier that day and still had a price sticker on the handle.
